intro: Arctotheca calendula, commonly known as the common sandmat, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its distinctive yellow daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in coastal regions. It has small, lobed leaves and produces achenes as its fruit type. Arctotheca calendula is known for its adaptability to harsh environments and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
